CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 11, 1958, pg. 1, reads: "Fire Guts Home - This dwelling, recently vacated in Ingram Palace and which stands directly in front of the 'apartment' in which Mrs. Caroletha Williams and her family of five children live, was gutted by fire early last Thursday morning. The blaze scorched and blistered the Williams' family home and threatened four families, consisting of lone mothers and a total of 23 children.  These families have not yet been relocated from the Ingram Palace project.  Some of the children can be seen playing in front of the damaged house.  Most of these youngsters and their mothers have been shifted from one hovel to another all of their lives. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Children playing with hula hoops, possibly from Williams and Thomas families, in front of burned house in Ingram Palace housing project, Ingram, Pennsylvania
